message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product which I know is of great value to your business. My asking price is $950,000.  I believe this is a fair price considering the significant benefits this product will bring to your operations. Let me know your thoughts.

Alice, I appreciate your offer, but $950,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with at this point. Considering the value of this product to me, I'd be willing to pay $850,000. This would be a fair price for both of us, allowing you to make a solid profit while securing a good deal for my business.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I appreciate your offer. However, $850,000 is significantly lower than what I need to make this worthwhile.  I'm willing to come down to $900,000.  This is a fair compromise that still allows me to make a profit while ensuring you get a valuable product at a competitive price.

Alice,  I understand your position, but $900,000 is still a bit high for me. To make this work, I'm willing to offer $875,000.  This is a fair compromise that allows us both to walk away feeling satisfied with the deal.
